item.title: Python Application
item.description: Today we will be looking at some applications of python and how it can be used to analyze data. #python dog_lifespan ={ 'German Shepherd': 11, 'Golden Retriever': 11, 'French Bulldog': 8, 'Boxer': 9, 'Great Dane': 6, 'Shih Tzu': 14, 'Havanese': 15, 'Bernese Mountain Dogs': 6, } dog_lifespan ## {'German Shepherd': 11, 'Golden Retriever': 11, 'French Bulldog': 8, 'Boxer': 9, 'Great Dane': 6, 'Shih Tzu': 14, 'Havanese': 15, 'Bernese Mountain Dogs': 6} dog_weight ={ 'German Shepherd': 66, 'Golden Retriever': 65, 'French Bulldog': 20, 'Boxer': 60, 'Great Dane': 120, 'Shih Tzu': 9, 'Havanese': 10, 'Bernese Mountain Dogs': 84, } dog_weight ## {'German Shepherd': 66, 'Golden Retriever': 65, 'French Bulldog': 20, 'Boxer': 60, 'Great Dane': 120, 'Shih Tzu': 9, 'Havanese': 10, 'Bernese Mountain Dogs': 84} #r library(reticulate) py$dog_weight['Boxer'] ## $Boxer ## [1] 60 py$dog_lifespan$Boxer ## [1] 9 py$dog_lifespan ## $`German Shepherd` ## [1] 11 ## ## $`Golden Retriever` ## [1] 11 ## ## $`French Bulldog` ## [1] 8 ## ## $Boxer ## [1] 9 ## ## $`Great Dane` ## [1] 6 ## ## $`Shih Tzu` ## [1] 14 ## ## $Havanese ## [1] 15 ## ## $`Bernese Mountain Dogs` ## [1] 6
